regulationsummary: MAS Notice 626 requires Singapore banks to conduct customer due diligence CDD for all customers and transactions, with higher scrutiny for highrisk categories such as politically exposed persons PEPs, customers from highrisk jurisdictions, and digital token transactions  Banks must verify identities, identify beneficial owners, and maintain records for at least five years  Simplified CDD may be applied only to lowrisk customers, while enhanced due diligence EDD is mandatory for PEPs, highrisk jurisdictions, and suspicious or complex transactions  Banks must also provide detailed information for wire and value transfers, monitor ongoing activity, and file suspicious transaction reports STRs when warranted

actionablerules.obligation: Perform full CDD identity verification, beneficial owner identification, and risk assessment before establishing business relations or executing any transaction exceeding S20,000, any crossborder wire transfer exceeding S1,500, or any digital token transaction for a customer who has not otherwise established business relations
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: All new customers and nonaccount transactions above the specified thresholds
risksignalstomonitor: Large single or aggregated transactions that exceed thresholds
Transactions involving customers with incomplete or missing CDD data
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Customer identification documents ID card, passport, incorporation papers
Approval from senior management for highrisk customers
actionablerules.requiresedd: Yes  if the customer is a PEP, from a highrisk jurisdiction, or the transaction is otherwise high risk, EDD must be performed

actionablerules.obligation: Identify and verify the beneficial owners of any legal person or legal arrangement, unless the customer is exempted under paragraph 616
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: Legal persons and legal arrangements that are not exempted eg, nonlisted companies, nonfinancial institutions, trusts
risksignalstomonitor: Absence of identifiable natural person owners
Complex ownership structures with opaque control chains
requireddocumentsorcontrols: List of ultimate beneficial owners with ID and address
Verification of ownershipcontrol through reliable sources
actionablerules.requiresedd: Yes  if the beneficial owner is a PEP, from a highrisk jurisdiction, or the ownership structure is complex or opaque

actionablerules.obligation: Apply EDD for any customer, natural person acting on behalf of a customer, connected party, or beneficial owner who is a PEP, a family member, or a close associate of a PEP
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: PEPs, their families, and close associates
risksignalstomonitor: Public office holder status
Recent changes in political status
Known associations with highrisk individuals
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Senior management approval to establishcontinue relationship
Source of wealth and source of funds documentation
actionablerules.requiresedd: Yes  EDD is mandatory for all PEPs and their close associates

actionablerules.obligation: Treat customers or beneficial owners from jurisdictions where FATF has called for countermeasures or where the jurisdiction is known to have inadequate AMLCFT measures as higher risk and apply EDD
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: Customers and beneficial owners from highrisk jurisdictions
risksignalstomonitor: Origin of funds from highrisk jurisdictions
Lack of regulatory oversight in the jurisdiction
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Additional verification of source of funds
actionablerules.requiresedd: Yes  EDD is required for all customers from highrisk jurisdictions

actionablerules.obligation: Apply simplified CDD only to customers identified as low risk, and only if the customer is not from a highrisk jurisdiction, not a PEP, and no suspicion of money laundering or terrorism financing exists
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: Lowrisk customers and financial institutions listed in Appendix 2
risksignalstomonitor: Customer profile indicating low risk
No adverse media or sanctions screening hits
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Basic identity information name, ID number, address
actionablerules.requiresedd: No  simplified CDD is sufficient for lowrisk customers

actionablerules.obligation: For any digital token transaction, perform CDD and record transaction details, and apply EDD if the transaction is above S20,000 or involves a highrisk customer
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: All customers engaging in digital token transactions
risksignalstomonitor: Large token transfers
Transactions involving anonymous or pseudonymous wallets
Transfers to or from highrisk jurisdictions
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Senior management approval for highrisk transactions
actionablerules.requiresedd: Yes  EDD is required for highrisk digital token transactions

actionablerules.obligation: Include full originator and beneficiary information name, account number, address, ID number in all crossborder wire transfer messages, and for domestic transfers include at least the originators account number and, where requested, full details
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: All banks acting as ordering institutions for wire transfers
risksignalstomonitor: Missing or incomplete originatorbeneficiary details
Transfers to or from highrisk jurisdictions
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Transaction record with unique reference number
Compliance with 3day request window for additional info
actionablerules.requiresedd: No  standard CDD suffices, but EDD may be triggered if the transfer is high risk

actionablerules.obligation: Reject, suspend, or investigate any wire transfer that lacks required originator or beneficiary information, and file an STR if suspicious
risksignalstomonitor: Incomplete transfer messages
Unusual routing patterns
Suspicious beneficiary accounts
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Documentation of investigation and STR filing
actionablerules.requiresedd: Yes  if the missing information indicates a highrisk scenario

actionablerules.obligation: Implement ongoing monitoring to detect complex, unusually large, or unusual transaction patterns that lack an apparent economic or lawful purpose
risksignalstomonitor: Rapid movement of funds across multiple accounts
Highfrequency smallvalue transactions smurfing
Transactions with no clear business rationale
actionablerules.requiresedd: Yes  if monitoring identifies highrisk patterns, EDD must be performed

actionablerules.obligation: Maintain records of all CDD information, transaction details, and monitoring findings for at least five years after the termination of the business relationship or completion of the transaction
risksignalstomonitor: Failure to retain records beyond the statutory period
Inadequate documentation of CDD or monitoring
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Secure storage system paper or electronic
actionablerules.requiresedd: No  record keeping is a compliance requirement, not an EDD trigger

actionablerules.obligation: Promptly file a Suspicious Transaction Report STR with STRO for any transaction suspected of money laundering or terrorism financing, regardless of amount, and provide a copy to the Authority upon request
risksignalstomonitor: Unusual transaction structure
Customer reluctance to provide information
Inconsistent source of funds
actionablerules.requiresedd: Yes  filing an STR often triggers EDD if the underlying customer or transaction is high risk
